etymologies: late Middle English: (in the spelling maker, a sense of maker); the Scottish spelling dates from the late 15th century, while the modern use originated in the 21st century

examples.text: poetry is in great shape, with Robertson and Paterson prominent among the many makars, as Scots of old called their poets

definitions: (in Scotland) an eminent poet appointed by an official body, especially one appointed by the government as the national poet of Scotland

examples.text: in 2011 she was named as the second Scots Makar
being Edinburgh Makar for the last six years has been a great honor

shortDefinitions: poet appointed by Scottish Parliament as national poet
